text: Hey Andrew, being in Foundation year is totally fine. I’m actually in a bit of a strange position myself, work wise, but I’ll get into that later.

For studio life I can try and share stories of previous studios I’ve worked at. I can try and share more current ones as well where possible, but generally I’m not at liberty to share those because of NDAs.
Is there anything in particular regarding studio life you’re curious about?
For advice as an animator, there is one piece of advice I can give you now that was given to me by a Disney animator: “Always keep going.”
I was at the end of my second year in uni (I was studying game development) and I had some doubts about my animation skill, something that happens to many animators at many points in their career.

Luckily I had a friend that was presenting at Siggraph that year and he gave me a guest pass. I found out that the day he was presenting there was a Disney review room set up to have Disney employers feedback people’s reels.

It took some courage but I went in and asked for feedback. The guy they sat me down with was really nice and to my surprise he said that I had a lot to improve on but that he saw something in my work. I told him about why I was there and that was the advice he gave. Just keep animating, even when you or other people have doubts, and you will improve and get there.
